snippet: Incinerated body parts from the Shanksville, Pa., crash site were not sent to a landfill, an Air Force official said.
abstract: Pentagon states that some remains from the Sept 11 attack on the Pentagon, but not remains from the plane crash site in Shanksville, Pa, were ordered incinerated by the Department of Defense in what it describes as a common practice at the time; statement is at odds with an independent report on procedural failings at the mortuary at Dover Air Force Base in Delaware.
lead_paragraph: Incinerated body parts from the Shanksville, Pa., crash site were not sent to a landfill, an Air Force official said.

headline.seo: Pentagon Contradicts Panel Findings on Disposal of 9/11 Remains
